title._content: ["The Orchard," James Lawrence Breese house, 151 Hill Street, Southampton, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["The Orchard," James Lawrence Breese house, 151 Hill Street, Southampton, New York. Pergola] [1912] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: McKim, Mead & White, 1898-1907. Landscape: McKim, Mead & White, 1898-1907. Other: or 1906 plan of this garden, see slide 16445. Today: House, converted to Whitefield condominiums, is on the National Register of Historic Places. On slide (handwritten): "B" and "Breese" and no. 1363." Also, gold star sticker and red stroke mark. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Gardens--New York (State)--Southampton--1910-1920. Pergolas--New York (State)--Southampton--1910-1920. Vines--New York (State)--Southampton--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16224 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 15
